body_html:
Also see #6150, which describes related issue -- summaries cannot be named as another existing op in the graph. So for example, if there is an op loss in the graph, it is not possible to create summary with the same name.

The proposal in #6150 is to optionally pass the whole name of the summary (not just a prefix) as a string tensor. That would also solve my problem.
body_text:
Also see #6150, which describes related issue -- summaries cannot be named as another existing op in the graph. So for example, if there is an op loss in the graph, it is not possible to create summary with the same name.
The proposal in #6150 is to optionally pass the whole name of the summary (not just a prefix) as a string tensor. That would also solve my problem.
body:
Also see #6150, which describes related issue -- summaries cannot be named as another existing op in the graph. So for example, if there is an op `loss` in the graph, it is not possible to create summary with the same name.

The proposal in #6150 is to optionally pass the whole name of the summary (not just a prefix) as a string tensor. That would also solve my problem.
